text: Konstantin Mirchev (; born 24 July 1978) is a Bulgarian footballer who last played as a midfielder for Lokomotiv Plovdiv. His first club was CSKA Sofia. ==Career== He was a midfielder for Cypriot club Omonia Aradippou in 2008-2009 and 2009-2010. He was the leading scorer for Omonia for both seasons. Bulgarian football star Dimitar Berbatov, Mirchev's former teammate at CSKA, cited Mirchev when asked to name his closest friends. He said Mirchev was a staunch supporter of Berbatov's decision to retire from the national team in May 2010. == References == Category:Bulgarian footballers Category:1978 births Category:Living people Category:Association football midfielders Category:First Professional Football League (Bulgaria) players Category:Cypriot Second Division players Category:Omonia Aradippou players Category:Onisilos Sotira players Category:PFC CSKA Sofia players Category:PFC Spartak Varna players Category:PFC Cherno More Varna players Category:FC Botev Vratsa players Category:PFC Lokomotiv Plovdiv players Category:Expatriate footballers in Cyprus
title: Konstantin Mirchev
